website_summaries.verdict: This model is similar to Remington's other corded 8-amp pole saw, with a little less control but slightly more power.
pros: Features a detachable head, which allows users to convert from pole saw to chain saw
Slightly more powerful than some comparable Remington Models
cons: This one does not include the improved ergonomic grip of some other Remington models, so it may be more difficult for some users to control comfortably
This model is a little heavy for smaller users, making it difficult to control for some when the pole is fully extended

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed, really would like my money back
customer_reviews.text: Very Disappointed, really would like my money back, after using this saw 3 times the switch on the pole does not work... The saw works on its own but what good is it with out the the pole... thats the whole reason I bought it. Its been sitting in my garage for 2 years.. since i had such a difficult time trying to get it fixed... Apparently you have to find a Remington repair shop near you... more money and time just to take it there. Where can I find parts for this so i can fix the switch myself
customer_reviews.author: Robert Drong

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one
customer_reviews.text: This thing is much better than the ryobi that made through two short sessions and died. You can tell the quality difference from the get go. I chopped 4 - 3 inch bush trees that were 7 feet high and then chopped them up. No constant chain adjustment like the ryobi. In fact, not one at all. Chopping them up became much easier as the saw comes apart from the pole so you don't have to stand 5 feet back and lose leverage on the ground. con- bit heavy. I had to go on a roof to reach some branches and the weight made it a bit scary. Very quick on cutting through though.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Bar and chain oil leaks out faster than you can fill the reservoir. DO NOT BUY THIS SAW!
customer_reviews.text: The telescoping pole works okay, as does the saw itself. It is definitely a light-duty saw, appropriate for small limbs and brush. It cuts okay as well, but with a chainsaw (whether gas or electric) you need to lubricate the chain/bar interface. Most saws use a metering valve that pumps oil to the bar and sprocket during use, but this saw does NOT have a pump; it is gravity-feed to the oil passage and the bar oil will strart leaking immediately and continue until the reservoir is empty. It detracts from the efficient use of the saw and is a pain to operated. Don't buy this junk!
customer_reviews.author: Richard J.

customer_reviews.title: Pole saw-we I bought this
customer_reviews.text: The thing never really worked on the pole so I just used the saw handheld until that too broke after two days of use. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C. Naubert

customer_reviews.title: this stopped working in less than 6 months. called ...
customer_reviews.text: this stopped working in less than 6 months. called remington and they told us to take it to one of three places. those places do not fix the pole saws. getting the run around. bought an extended warranty that doesn't take effect until after the one year warranty is up
customer_reviews.author: a m ware

customer_reviews.title: Tough little saw
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised at how well this sa W has performed. It has a very good reach with the extension and though it's made to cut smaller limbs I have cut 15 or 20 10" to 18" full sized trees with no problem. The only problem I have seen is the saw dust chips get stuck in the housing, it needs bigger holes in the bottom for them to fall out. Have used full sized gas saws many times and this cuts right up there with the best of them.
customer_reviews.author: Kim T.

customer_reviews.title: Good extension
customer_reviews.text: Good, sturdy saw. Goes together nicely, extends to a good length. My only complaint has to do with the saw body hanging on the left of the saw blade. As a right-hander, the saw body therefore wants to be in the way of seeing the limb to be sawn. However, it occurs to me that if the body were on the right, the saw might be hard to balance. Buy one for yourself and make up your own mind: it will definitely cut a 6" diameter branch off your oak tree.
customer_reviews.author: AnotherJim

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: I did a major trim up on an overgrown Maple. Using a boom truck I was able to take down heavy limbs. It cuts through soft wood like butter. I went too deep on a back cut and got the bar pinched. I couldn't reach it and went back down to get a rope. Before I could get back up to it the limb broke and the saw crashed 20+ feet to the gravel driveway. All that broke was the tensioner adjustment. I put the chain back on and went back to work. I trimmed up a couple of pines. I'm not really impressed with the oiling system but for the money, this saw is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A really good saw. Much better than the ones I see ...
customer_reviews.text: A really good saw. Much better than the ones I see in hardware stores. Not that I could find any at all after the hurricane, which is why I looked on Amazon, but I really abused this little saw getting all of the downed trees chopped up and trimming the ones still standing. The saw ate it all up !!! I did make it a 12-inch saw because I had the bar and chain from my old saw so that helped a bit. I will probably buy another one just so I have a spare. With my luck, they will discontinue this great saw.
customer_reviews.author: Walrus 305

customer_reviews.title: A good value
customer_reviews.text: The saw works well and the pole extends quite far and locks positively. My one beef is that the cord comes out of the bottom of the handle of the pole, so if you rest the pole vertically on the ground it rests on the cord, which is bound to cause the cord to fail at some point. Be forewarned, it is also quite top heavy when the pole is extended, so wear a hard hat and be prepared to hold it upright when it cuts through the limb.
customer_reviews.author: drpj

customer_reviews.title: Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Really Heavy, hard to use without getting tired, chews rather than cuts larger branches that fit in cutting zone, sounds like a machine gun.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 year then burned up
customer_reviews.text: This burned up after only 1 year. I used it about 6 or 7 times. The quality is not what I expected. Also, branches and particles get stuck while using it in between the chain and the plastic piece that covers the end of the chain forcing me to get out my socket set and remove the plastic plate and clean it out a few times each time I use it. I am going to buy another electric pole chain saw but I need one that lasts more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: McChesney

customer_reviews.title: A lot more useful and capable than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I've used this to take down a 30' hemlock, 30' hazlenut, and 30' flowering plumb. Readily cut through 16" diameter limbs. I keep the chain properly lubed and tensioned and have not had any problems whatsoever. The neighbors are really surprised what I can do with this little saw. So much better than messing with a 2-cycle, and the extension pole is a huge safety benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Atomic1

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased during winter to ready for spring, so delayed to take it out of the box, beyond the amazon return timeline. This did not work, the throttle lock and trigger were stuck. It's been difficult to get customer support or assistance to get this fixed. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Saw has worked fine ever since
customer_reviews.text: I had a Remington pole saw that I used for about 10 years before motor burned up. On second use of the new saw the lockout button got stuck after sawing quite a few branches not allowing me to push the trigger. I saw this problem on several reviews. I had already thrown the box away so while I was trying to figure out how to send pole saw back, I took the saw apart and played with the trigger. Eventually I was able to push lockout button in and use trigger. Saw has worked fine ever since, hopefully I'll get 10 years out of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Coover

customer_reviews.title: Good Light Duty Chain/Pole Saw
customer_reviews.text: Nice little saw, heavy when extending it so don't expect to be able to hold it at arms length unless you have very strong arms. Also, be careful when using it; I burnt mine out trying to cut too large of a limb,the chain got in a bind and burned out the motor. It is easy to hold as just a chainsaw, but as expected, it is a little bulky when trying to use it on the extension pole. The on/off mechanism on the pole is convenient and assembling the polesaw is easy, just keep up with the tightening nut. I'd buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: dallis8491

customer_reviews.title: Great saw but redesign the pole attachment system
customer_reviews.text: Does a wonderful job, easy to use, good safeguards, rugged. Very top-heavy (to be expected, I guess) but a nice design on the pole. My only gripe is the way the saw attaches to the handle--a thumbscrew (which is OK) and a tiny crenellated washer (very easy to drop or lose).
customer_reviews.author: Max M. Houck

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have purchased this earlier! Paid for itself in the first 45 minutes of use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to trim trees on my quarter acre lots in the suburbs. We have about 10 full sized trees on the lot. We were able to trim almost all of the branches from the ground. In 45 minutes of use my wife an I were able to make a very large pile of dead limbs. It does get a little heavy when you are reaching for higher branches. The trimming we did would have cost $100 easy if we hired a pro. My Wife also used it and had no issues with the weight or controlling the saw. Can wait to use this again in the fall to further trim our trees.
customer_reviews.author: Chance1117

customer_reviews.title: Good little saw
customer_reviews.text: For what it is, it's awesome. It has a lot more power than I expected. I used it to cut a large dead tree that was at least 18" wide. I didn't want to use the gas saw because the vibrations might break the top off the tree. I was able to stand 6 feet back, practically behind another larger tree and fell the dead one. I could have easily jumped behind the larger live tree if my spotter had seen anything break off the dead one. As it was, nothing did break off and the tree fell where I wanted. I used this little saw to cut off the branches and it did a swell job.
customer_reviews.author: JVL

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I cut up a tree that fell in my backyard in about ten minutes. It was about eight inches through the thickest part so i would give it about ten pumps of oil per cut to lubricate the chain. One hitch i ran into and this is on me,i forgot to press the safety button when i attached the pole to the saw handle. When i tried to use the saw the trigger on the pole was locked out. Easy to miss but easy to fix. Saw seems flimsy when using it but it easily handled what i threw at it.
customer_reviews.author: Don Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Nice. I probably have saved several times this amount in fees by being able to trim a few trees on my own. Well enough made. It's not magic...Just because it's on a pole doesn't make it easy .... but does allow you to reach farther ...and safer than you otherwise might have. Be safe...wear eye protection...and a helmet if you can (yes, I got bonked in the head by a branch).
customer_reviews.author: Papa Homer

customer_reviews.title: My dad loves it
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my dad, he can't stop gushing about how awesome it is. He is 72 now and he says it is very easy to use and handle. He has no problem cutting big branches off of trees in this hot Miami Heat because this machine makes it so easy for him. He loves to cut down coconuts, papaya, and mangoes off of his trees with this as well. Before getting this, he would just let the birds get to all the mangoes and be sad and complained about it to me often Hahaha. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Champagne Satayakul

customer_reviews.title: Husband had fun trimming trees with this!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, did my husband have fun trimming trees with this when it arrived. Thank goodness I was home or we wouldn't have any branches left on the oak out front! Easy to dismount the saw to cut up the branches after he had cut them from the tree. This crazy little thing works great for most of our branch removal needs. Awesome little saw and pole.
customer_reviews.author: TexAnne

customer_reviews.title: This thing is fantastic! I bought it for my husband to use
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic! I bought it for my husband to use, but I would have no problems using it myself. It has great power and can cut up to 10" around if you take your time and don't force it. We saved ourselves $1000 by not hiring someone to cut the limbs and small trees on our property. Couldn't be happier. I did not receive a discount for my honest opinion. I'm a real buyer who is thrilled with this product.
customer_reviews.author: NatH

customer_reviews.title: Generally a good product. The handle extends easily and locks in ...
customer_reviews.text: Generally a good product. The handle extends easily and locks in several positions. The saw has plenty of power and is not too heavy to lift up to higher cuts. Detaching or attaching the saw to the handle is easy and secure. I was trimming trees in a remote location and used a Honda 2500 generator. I believe a somewhat smaller one would work as well. I have only two concerns. One is that the plastic saw housing, while sufficient, obviously isn't as strong as metal. Second is that the plastic chain oil pump blister is made out of plastic instead of rubber and is difficult to operate. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: broke in Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: took to repair shop recommended by mfg
customer_reviews.text: delivered on Aug 16, could not use as it had a defective throttle and throttle lock. took to repair shop recommended by mfg. They still have it and are waiting on MTD to replace defective part. so, 2 months later I have never been able to use the product I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This has the most power of the small ones and ...
customer_reviews.text: This has the most power of the small ones and is well worth it. I use this on everything unless I need my 20in gas powered. It spends more time off than on the pole and a lot less maintenance than my gas powered. This is the only power tool I own that I prefer electric to gas powered and according to my wife I have every tool in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Blodgett

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Read directions carefully. Easy to put together. Have used as hand held chain saw and pole saw. I have no upper body strength( older female), therefore it was hard for me to reach the higher tree limbs. Works great. Love it. Will be very useful addition to my property.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, I didn't realize an electric chain saw ...
customer_reviews.text: Great saw, I didn't realize an electric chain saw had so much power. All the trees in the yard are getting afraid now that I can trim them quickly and without to much damage. It is a little heavy when fully extended but I need the exercise anyway. All in all I am very much satisfied with the pole saw. I like the feature that you can use it as a chain saw without the pole. Also good delivery service.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Slaviero

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with this Pole Saw
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw replaced another brand that had worn out. I have used it a few hours now and it works better than my old one. The pole extension on the old one had frozen so it was no longer adjustable. This one will never do that, I don't think, because the locking method is different. It has plenty of power too. The old saw chain kept coming off, that has not happened with this one yet. It is a 2-in1, but I will never use it as a standard saw because I have another saw for that purpose, so I cannot evaluate that function. I am very pleased with this pole saw.
customer_reviews.author: R. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME TOOL!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is exactly what I need and does exactly what it says it can do. When I got the first unit I tested it be fore actually using it on my out of control backyard. . The saw worked fine, however when I connected to the extension pole no power, so something must be defective with the electrical connection on the pole. I did the return online and printed the return label and planned on dropping it off at the UPS store in a day or two, the replacement arrived before I returned the defective one. GREAT SERVICE!
customer_reviews.author: richard f conrad

customer_reviews.title: Remington's two year warranty is useless!
customer_reviews.text: Remington's two year warranty is useless! I have a problem with the switch so the saw won't turn on. Remington support line was no help!. All of the warranty service locations provided by the Remington support line within 100 miles of location (the entire LA basin) only work on gas-powered equipment. I still have not located a warranty repair facility that will work on the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Erwin Ruhland

customer_reviews.title: absolute junk!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: do not buy this!!!! first one i got did not work at all. returned it for replacement. 2nd one arrived....the saw worked fine when plugged in lone. however, when mounted to pole.....did not work. took pole part, looking for wiring problems. returned it to Amazon for credit.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Y.

customer_reviews.title: Look out Trees
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gadget! Easily one of the best purchased I've made all year. It functions just as described and certainly makes any tree trimming task much easier. Only complaint is the head of the unit is a little bulky making the saw harder to get between some smaller branches but overall A+.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Swinden

customer_reviews.title: Best Electric Pole Saw Out There!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cuts as good as units costing 3x the price. Very easy to use, & trip limbs overhead. Remove saw from pole & you have compact electric chainsaw; cut 8" logs with no problem! Best tool purchase in a LONG time!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Coldren

customer_reviews.title: What a Back saver, easy to use and works well
customer_reviews.text: THis worked extremely well for my home needs. Large l​imb Split from the tree. I rented a bucket to cut the limb down, the Remington RM1015P Branch Wizard was just the right length to keep the limbs from hitting me and the bucket and I did not put myself into harms way. without the extension I would have been in much more danger of a large limb hitting me or the bucket and causing some real damage. I also used the Remington RM1015P Branch Wizard, while cutting up limbs on the ground to smaller pieces. It allowed me to cut the limbs at a safe distance and save your back from bending over all the time.
customer_reviews.author: B A S

customer_reviews.title: This saw is for occasional use and not a daily ...
customer_reviews.text: This saw is for occasional use and not a daily tool. The trigger portion of the pole has some design issues and mine failed after a couple weeks of use. the pole is of course heavy on the saw end, this puts extra stress on the handle portion that contains the trigger. I found that after a few weeks of use that my handle separated and I had to use tape to keep it from opening.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Eric Pate

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this pole saw!
customer_reviews.text: This a great tool for home use! I ordered this so that I could trim trees in our yard instead of my husband having to do it every year. It is light yet powerful & cuts really well. The only problem is that our son loves it, also - so most of the time it is at his house 200 miles away!! I'm ordering him one for Christmas!! That's how much we love this pole saw!!
customer_reviews.author: LakeLady

customer_reviews.title: Love this versatile little saw
customer_reviews.text: Love this versatile little saw. If most the the jobs you can imagine are within reach of a 100' extension cord, and you don't want to mess with gas, go for it! I was surprised how many branches I can reach with a 20' foot extension ladder and a 12' pole saw.
customer_reviews.author: david from Tucson

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price.
customer_reviews.text: Value for the price good ,have had it for two years still running, still sharp chain. Agree with other reviews hand heavy so does tire your arms out easy, has nice reach , trim mesquite trees which is a hard wood and it takes the biggest branches off with ease, biggest being 10" to 12" around .
customer_reviews.author: Kimik

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for one day. Then garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Trigger and lockout seized after the first day. Chain oil was used. I Wish I didn’t buy it way ahead of time, so I could return it or for warranty. I wouldn’t take the chance if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: For a $90.00 tool it performs as advertised. If you are looking for a commercial grade saw this isn't it, but for the normal homeowner with a few trees to maintain it works very well. It takes some getting used to when you have the pole fully extended, but after a few cuts you learn the balance point and use the saw weight to do the work. Be sure to read the instructions on the proper oil to use on the chain. The saw paid for itself on the first use so I am a happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: IflyA10s

customer_reviews.title: Great little chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little chainsaw for the money. My girlfriend has an older model but basically the same saw and pole. I use it with and without the pole for pruning and chopping up thicker sections of oak limbs for use on the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Remington RM1015P 10 inch 8 Amp pole saw
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I love how light it is and that I don't have to worry about mixing the oil and gas. Plus I don't have to wonder it's going to start or not. Just push a safety button and the hold down the trigger and there it goes. Obviously I only use this around the house with a very long extension cord, 100 feet, but I'm not a lumberjack so I don't go in the back woods to fell trees. I have chopped many 10 inch plus branches with this without difficulty. Just give it lots of bar oil and let the chain saw do the work. I've owned for 2 years now and still love it.
customer_reviews.author: House Atreides

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: One of my best tool purchase that I have done over the last 5 years. Have no idea of how long it will last, but I have really transformed my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Good for light triming
customer_reviews.text: Works for light duty work. I carry around the yard on my lawn cart with a generator and use it to prune trees. For bigger work I use a gas chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz Cat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Pro - Easy to assemble and disassemble Plenty of cutting power Light enough to use at full extension, but it takes some getting used to. Con - Can't oil the bar when mounted on pole The only way to oil the bar during pole mounted use is to put the saw in a safe position, unplug from the pole extension, and plug the saw directly into the extension cord. I don't know what else they could have done, but see the potential for lots of people burning their bars. I oiled after every 3-inches of cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: It was a little heavy but it cut the high branches without having to get a ladder. The chain was very sharp and cut through the branches easily. The telescoping handle worked great. I did need a second pair of hands for the high, high branches with the handle fully extended.
customer_reviews.author: Duanek5

customer_reviews.title: Easily cuts through thick branches
customer_reviews.text: I don't have anything to compare this with because it's the first chainsaw I've ever used, and also the first pole-saw I've ever used, but it cut through a very thick branch (maybe a foot thick) with ease. One thing I'd like everyone to know: don't buy bar and chain oil because the manual says not to use it because it's too thick and there won't be enough oil coming out onto the chain. The manual says to just use standard SAE 30, or, for hot weather, SAE 40. I had to sell the bar and chain oil I bought because it's not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Colin K.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product the only bad thing is the latch that ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good product the only bad thing is the latch that keeps it extended ,cheap plastic it broke in the first use. Contacted amazon they don't carry a replacement ,I will have to call the manufacturer.they did offer a replacement of product or partial credit . 5 stars for amazon customer service.remington could use a better way of locking the poll when extended.
customer_reviews.author: Myron mccowan

customer_reviews.title: A Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had an old mesquite tree growing at about a 45 degree angle, and needed to get rid of a big portion of it. My sister's boy friend brought over his RM1015P pole saw and sawed through a 12+ inch section of it. He had to make a cut from both sides, but there were no other problems. Afterwards, I purchased the same model Remington pole saw and have used it on and off since then. I would give a five star rating, but for some reason I cannot get the on/off trigger mechanism to always engage while wearing gloves??
customer_reviews.author: LarryC

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very useful for trimming larger branches at a distance... Make sure you have a long enough extension cord to power it. The actual saw detaches for close up cutting but I use it on the adjustable pole and just stand several steps back.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Katowik

customer_reviews.title: pole chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw works great. It is easy to cut high branches without a ladder. It oils itself. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: hillbillycat

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: Well had this item for about a month now, and I shall say it is a great saw, the only down side of it is once it is on the pole and fully extended, it is a bit on the heavy side, but other than that this saw is just great, lots of power, blade/bar size is perfect for cutting through damn near everything, easy to use, I mean this thing is so much fun to use it should be illegal :) Changing unit from pole saw to chain-saw is so simple even a caveman could do it (like me). So if your looking for a great quality pole-saw/chain-saw I would definitely give this on a try.
customer_reviews.author: hdangelalex

customer_reviews.title: Testosterone on a stick
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like a chain saw to bring one's manliness to the fore. This one is more powerful than I anticipated, and the fact that it can be used both at ground level targets and those in the air is an added advantage. The saw attaches easily to the pole. Trimming that limb over your fence, no problem (assuming you don't smash the fence). Cleans up yard trash in a snap. I did not experience the oil leakage described by others. The chain doesn't turn fast enough to burn, so oiling isn't as critical as with a gas saw. And the fact that it's green will appeal to your feminine side.
customer_reviews.author: William Croom

customer_reviews.title: Flexible, Useful, Durable and extra-Safe
customer_reviews.text: Lots of reviews so I'll keep it short. I've used this both on, and off the pole to the point where if it died I'd still be happy with it, but it's still going strong. Lots and lots of use. I keep it sharp, adjusted and use the prescribed 30 weight chain oil. It also allows me to make cuts either from the ground, or on a ladder, when I'm in a better position to get out of the way if something falls. We've used this to safely make the final cuts on limbs that were still hanging from a gas chain saw cut.
customer_reviews.author: Tom D

customer_reviews.title: Handle slips but ez fix
customer_reviews.text: Second one I've had. Works well except for clamp that holds the extension. It is not tight enough after the first few uses. Both mine had that problem. Next door neighbor has one. Same problem. I extend it and wrap black electrical tape around it to hold it in place. The oiler could be better too but I liked it well enough to buy a second.
customer_reviews.author: F. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I tried the saw by itself and it works fine. However
customer_reviews.text: I tried the saw by itself and it works fine. However, once I connected the pole , it did not start. I tried it several times with the pole but in vain. I suspected the circuit breaker in my house tried; it was not (i.e. the circuit breaker was fine). I called Remington company and they suspected a defective circuitry in the pole. So, they are shipping me a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Ali A. Almehdi

customer_reviews.title: Great multipurpose yard tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it has both pole saw capabilities as well as normal chain saw usability. We cut down 3 apple trees, 2 mid-sized maple trees, trimmed a cherry bush/tree, and severely cut back a rhododendron. It handle all tasks well. You do need to use gravity and the dimple to feed oil, but if you stay on top of that, the tool works well and seems resilient.
customer_reviews.author: Blrg891

customer_reviews.title: This works great, my only complaint it is i cant see ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great, my only complaint it is i cant see the blade when fully extended. Its a blind cut, then it starts to get heavy on the arms when your trying to cut branch.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Remington 10-Inch Saw
customer_reviews.text: This a great product. This is my second one. My other one lasted about 12 years. It is extremely easy to use. I am surprised how long the blade stays sharp and it cuts through branches up to about 8 inches in diameter very quickly. The blade stops immediately when you release the trigger, and the button that you have to push to engage the trigger is an added safety feature. When my other one finally gave out, I looked at other brands, but decided "why mess with success?" I highly recommend this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Mtwillo

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to use and powerful
customer_reviews.text: this is really easy to use and actually is more powerful than most gas chainsaw i love it! doesn't trap much and if it does it dislodges easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: For a long time we had thought about getting a chainsaw to do jobs around the house but the idea seemed intimidating. This Remington saw is very easy to use. The blade is a good size (not scary for us as 1st time users) and it's large enough to cut through 5"-6" diameter branches. We removed the one bolt to separate the saw from the pole and cut the branches to smaller sizes. But my husband said it's rather heavy when the pole is extended. Anyway, we got the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jay J

customer_reviews.title: Branch Wizard
customer_reviews.text: I think this is pretty awesome. I am 62 so it is a little hard to hold up in the air but I managed to do a lot of tree trimming around my house, I just love it! It looks like I better start working out to strengthen my arm! The product is great and easy to put together. It really works great
customer_reviews.author: Elainey

customer_reviews.title: Other than arriving in a box that had an open flap on one end, it appeared to arrive unscathed & work properly.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for a friend who broke his boss's while cutting down a tree on my property. Other than arriving in a box that had an open flap on one end, it appeared to arrive unscathed & work properly. This product is definitely designed for tree-trimming, not taking down an entire tree.
customer_reviews.author: Focusedone73

customer_reviews.title: best dual purpose saw
customer_reviews.text: i use this saw for cutting limbs from my pecan trees and then detach the saw and cut the limbs up. the saw detaches easy enough with no tools, and the saw is small enough to be light on the end of the pole yet useful enough for cutting limbs when detached. your not going to use this to cut a big tree down (unless you want it to be a one time use saw), but it works fine for what I use it for. It extends longer than most of the other pole saws, and detaches easier.
customer_reviews.author: caprock

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to use and very strong for it's size
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to use and very strong for it's size. Only problem is that when assembling it won't turn on when pressing the handle trigger.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Works great, the only problem is it accumulates stuff under ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, the only problem is it accumulates stuff under the chain, kinda hard to remove to clear the left over.
customer_reviews.author: Rougeh

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine in my small yard. Not too heavy to use.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: I have 2 of these
customer_reviews.text: I have property in Texas and cut live oak trees with this and it has given me good reliable service for over 2 years so I bought #2 to use on my cottonwoods and Ponderosa pines in Colorado. They both work very good and I also detach the saw to use as a portable saw for cutting firewood. Always keep the chain oiled (small reservoir - one small drawback) and the chained properly tightened. Never have had the chain jump out of the sprocket and cut up to 9" live oak branches. This is a good buy for what it was designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Happy customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked very good. Had a small problem with it
customer_reviews.text: Worked very good. Had a small problem with it, but was quickly replaced with a new one. Great job
customer_reviews.author: jeannie aton

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool, but use with caution
customer_reviews.text: This guy saved me from paying someone to trim overhanging limbs over the house. Easy to use, but it is a dangerous tool, so use caution. Gave four stars because the trigger quit functioning on saw when sawing downward. A small tie wrap fixed around the trigger fix it. More than paid for itself several times over and is still working great.
customer_reviews.author: Capt_denis

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and sharp
customer_reviews.text: Got it in the mail filled it with oil and it worked awesome used it to cut my palm trees in my backyard. Very powerful motor and sharp chainsaw. Didn't seem too heavy for me although anything on the end of a 10 foot pole that weighs 10 pounds can be awkward if you've never used one
customer_reviews.author: Mauro

customer_reviews.title: Wear a Helmet
customer_reviews.text: Good DIYer tool for trimming the trees. Good reach. Easy to operate and maintain.
customer_reviews.author: jonadab

customer_reviews.title: It cuts really well. Solid build. Not too ...
customer_reviews.text: It cuts really well. Solid build. Not too heavy. However, it doesn't seem to be putting out any oil when I push on the bulb. And yes, I did fill it with bar and chain oil.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Willey

customer_reviews.title: Great tree trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Trimmed all my trees. Even cut up small logs to split for my fireplace.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Lowry

customer_reviews.title: The motor has plenty of power to do small jobs ...
customer_reviews.text: The motor has plenty of power to do small jobs. However, this saw is much too heavy to handle on a pole if extended. If you have branches that are tough to reach or a little high you may want a lighter weight unit or a ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Posted 4 u in 2017

customer_reviews.title: It has a couple better features than my old one
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered a new one. .It has a couple better features than my old one. I used the same model for 10 years and never had a problem . It worked great until I used it for cutting out deep roots. My bad.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: A good product. Well made
customer_reviews.text: This saw is well made, except for the blade oiling setup. The operator is required to press a button periodically in order to keep the chain oiled. Before the first hour of use was over, the button perforated and I had to use an oil can to oil the chain from then on. Otherwise, I was pleased with the strength of the saw cut and the construction of the telescoping pole. Remington just needs to beef up the oiling system. That button needs to be made of tougher material.
customer_reviews.author: Dave R

customer_reviews.title: Great saw and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great saw and great customer service. Initially I had a problem with the saw and called their customer service dept. and a replacement was promptly mailed out...that's why I like to by American in general and Remington in particular, they make quality products and stand behind them.
customer_reviews.author: R. W.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing, I bought a gas stihl chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing, I bought a gas stihl chainsaw, and ended up only using the the stihl For the really big parts of the tree. This little electric chainsaw is a little beast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: Too heavy. Quite dangerous if you do not take extra special care. Not easy to handle. Description is not clear if the unit is with the extension pole or not.
customer_reviews.author: P. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great pole saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw is great I used it to trim back a neighbors cotton wood tree that was growing over the house, it cut through some big branches with no problem, and with the pole extension I was able to get the higher branches from the roof. make sure you follow instructions, check the chain tension also need to buy chain oil not included and check chain oil level, also cut down a full grown aspen tree with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Saved me a ton of money!
customer_reviews.text: I used it to trim my trees and my neighbors and it did a great job it looked like a professional had done it.
customer_reviews.author: patricia Schoenfeld

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw with decent power!
customer_reviews.text: I must say, I had my doubts in the beginning.....but no more! This saw cuts through limbs like butter! I swear, if I didn't know better, I was operating a gas operated saw. I had several dead limbs on my willow tree overlooking Lake Erie. I didn't know how I'd ever get near them, but this pole extension and electric saw did the trick. Just remember, to follow instructions AND USE MOTOR OIL.....Not Chain saw oil. Cut 6 inch limbs with no problems.....love this Remington Electric!
customer_reviews.author: Teddy

customer_reviews.title: nise size and light weight
customer_reviews.text: The saw works very well. I had an 8 inch before and this 10 inch makes a difference. Lightweight saw and easy to attach to pole or use without the pole.
customer_reviews.author: Denny B

customer_reviews.title: Works reasonably well except the rod construction
customer_reviews.text: The chain saw unit is made in the US, pretty sharp and responsive. Easy to handle as a stand alone saw. When mounted on the pole, the entire saw becomes pretty heavy especially when fully extended. Could hear some cracking sound from the lock of the two rod sections, as if it was going to break. Just need extra caution to do telescoping work if one does not have strong muscles. No extra issue so far otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Sheng

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw.
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks. Not too heavy. Decent power. Nice extras that make it easy. Only gripe is that it should come with a bottle of bar oil.
customer_reviews.author: joy's division

customer_reviews.title: No regrets.
customer_reviews.text: My brother recommended this Remington pole saw after he got one...its small but powerful...I was leaning towards a gasolene model but didn't want another small gas engine that didn't work after sitting out a few months or shutting down after overheating. This Remington Pole Saw earned its price the first couple of tree limbs that I cut. The deal was done on Amazon and went very smooth and very fast. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sawwow!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Borrowed one from a neighbor, and had to have one for myself! Use it all the time. Great for palms, shrubs, trees, will pay for itself in no time! Uses a small lightweight extension cord and saw allows great dexterity ex- tended or retracted. Quiet operation lets you work late or early without bothering the neighbors. When I shopped the market the only other product that got my attention was the stihl 2-stroke extendable saw.($420.00)This Remington product, in my opinion, is directly comparable in quality, doesn't burn mixed gasoline and works with the push of a button. What a charm!!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory J. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t come with the cover and bolt that holds the saw on the pole. Had to go buy the kit separately after finding out they could only do a full return and I’d have to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle

customer_reviews.title: Cut the branches you cannot reach
customer_reviews.text: Super Father's Day project to trim the branches and tree trunks that are out of reach. Both my husband and I used it to trim our River Birch tree. We have been using a manual blade cutter before this. This one is much more effective in attacking the high branches and cutting them down to size.
customer_reviews.author: JLS

customer_reviews.title: Poor switch design
customer_reviews.text: Switch on saw won't stay on when mounted to pole. I had to use a cable tie.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A Wolff

customer_reviews.title: ... to replace for cracked housing but Amazon makes it easy and love the little thing
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace for cracked housing but Amazon makes it easy and love the little thing...quite the cutter.
customer_reviews.author: BobBill

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Power
customer_reviews.text: I am used to a gas chainsaw so I was worried about power but this thing has it in spades. I use it to trim my palm trees which doesn't sound that bad but those things are hard to cut!
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Ford

customer_reviews.title: Oustanding!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely one of the best things I ever bought. Good quality and works great. Very lightweight compared to a gas saw. Got on the roof and trimmed back tons of branches that I never thought I would be able to get. Gutters stay much cleaner now. Knowing what I know now, I would have gladly paid twice as much for it. It's certainly worth every penny. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: RobsterMobster

customer_reviews.title: So far, so Good
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this saw twice, but this weekend I plan on doing much more. What little I have done so far was done easily and smoothly. The weight of the saw when the pole is completely extended does make it somewhat unwieldy, but that's the case with any of these saws that have an extension pole...it's just a matter of physics. But with my limited usage so far, I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in Dearborn

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: This saw is a good replacement for an older saw that was just worn-out.
customer_reviews.author: Jane A

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful little saw, good for reasonable heights, but also great without the pole. Cuts good size limbs.
customer_reviews.author: JayCal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw on a stick
customer_reviews.text: I read a few write ups on this saw before I got it and it seemed to have a lot of positives. The first night I got it, I tried it out on a locust tree. The limb was about 7 inches in diameter and it was up about 12 feet. I extended the pole, laid the saw on the limb and zip, it was on the ground. I took the saw off the pole and in 15 minutes I had a 20 foot limb cut and ready for fire wood. This thing is easy to use, easy to put together and take apart. This is my first 'electric' chain saw.. I am very impressed..
customer_reviews.author: DB

product_meta.title: Remington 41AZ32PG983 RM1025P Electric Pole Saw, 0.05, Orange
product_meta.description: The Remington RM1025P Ranger 2-in-1 Pole Saw/Chain Saw is lightweight and easy to use. This electric tree trimmer's powerful 8 amp motor and 10-inch bar and chain are perfect for trimming small to medium-size branches. The Remington RM1025P is equipped with a quick option to detach the 10-foot telescoping pole to convert from a pole saw to a chainsaw after you've brought down those high branches. The easy flip and lock capability clamps down quickly to secure the pole length. The Remington RM1025P has a non-slip grip for comfortable use and is ideal for trimming and pruning hard-to-reach branches. The Remington RM1025P is backed by a 2-year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: ADJUSTABLE: A telescoping design paired with flip and lock clamps allows the operator to quickly adjust the length of the pole saw so that trimming trees of varying heights isn’t a hassle
2-IN-1 FUNCTIONALITY: Logs on the ground? Simply detach the saw from the pole to convert the unit from a pole saw into a chainsaw No tools required!

LONG REACH: Designed with a shaft extendable up to 10-feet for high branches With operator height considered, the pole saw can cut limbs 10-feet to 15-feet overhead making those previously hard-to-reach places easy-to-reach

ELECTRIC POWERED: An 8-amp electric motor instantly starts to drive the chain over the low-kickback 10-inch bar and chain Get to work right away on your lawn care, trimming, yard work, and other projects
PRUNE IN COMFORT: Chainsaw has non-slip grip to enhance comfort and an Anti-rotation pole for stability during use Maintain optimal comfortability, comfort, and command
IMPORTANT NOTE: Bar and chain oil may seep from unit when not in use Remember to loosen the saw chain with the tool-free tensioner if it was adjusted during operation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars791 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
